title: Increase header logo visibility across the app

requirements.summary: Make the header top-left logo larger on mobile/desktop and improve its contrast on both light and dark header backgrounds without breaking navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: The logo in the header top-left is visibly larger than the current `h-8 w-8` (mobile) / `sm:h-10 sm:w-10` (desktop) sizing.
The logo remains clearly visible (high contrast) on both light mode and dark mode header backgrounds.
The change is applied everywhere the header appears (all pages routed via `App.tsx`).
No other navigation/header functionality is broken (logo click still navigates to the landing page).

file_operations.description: Increase the rendered logo size for mobile and desktop, and add a subtle high-contrast treatment around the logo (e.g., badge/background + ring/border + shadow and/or image drop-shadow) using Tailwind classes so it stays readable in both light and dark modes. Keep the existing click handler to navigate to the landing page and avoid modifying any `frontend/src/components/ui` primitives.

Verify the header usage remains unchanged and continues to be rendered for all routed pages (ensuring the logo visibility change applies app-wide via `App.tsx` composition). No routing/layout changes beyond whatâ€™s necessary for verification.

requirements.summary: Add a higher-contrast generated logo asset and switch the header to reference it consistently if needed for readability at the new size.
acceptanceCriteria: A higher-contrast logo asset exists under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and is referenced by `Header.tsx` (no backend routing for the image).
The new logo asset retains transparent edges cleanly (no unintended background artifacts) and appears sharper/more readable at the new size.

file_operations.description: Create a higher-contrast variant of the existing generated logo mark (as specified in image edits) with clean transparency and improved clarity at larger sizes. This must be a static frontend asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (no backend storage/routing).

Update the logo image `src` to reference the new asset path `frontend/public/assets/generated/platform-logo-high-contrast.dim_200x200.png` consistently for the header logo, ensuring it remains readable against both light and dark backgrounds while preserving existing navigation behavior.
